name: Apple Notes
description: The server implements the ability to read and write to your Apple Notes. Require Python>=3.12.

name: Database Utilities
description: A unified database access service supporting PostgreSQL and SQLite. With an abstraction layer design, it provides a simple, unified database operation interface for MCP servers.
Tools to read, search, and manipulate Git repositories

name: File System
description: The server will only allow operations within directories specified via args.
args: {{dirs@list::directories you about to access. Trailing slash in path required.}}

name: Hacker News
description: The server provides tools for fetching information from Hacker News
This server allowing LLMs to interact with Linear issues.
A Model Context Protocol server that provides macOS-specific system information and operations.
An MCP server gives LLMs read - only access to MySQL databases for schema inspection and query execution.
Read and search through your Obsidian vault or any directory containing Markdown notes.
Read-only database access with schema inspection.

name: Sequential Thinking
description: An MCP server tool for dynamic problem-solving with structured thinking.
A Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides search and crawl functionality using Search1API.
A Node.js MCP implementation enables secure shell command execution for AI models.
MCP Server for the Slack API, enabling Claude to interact with Slack workspaces.
An MCP server using SQLite allows SQL querying, business data analysis, and automatic memo generation.
Seamless interaction with the tavily-search and tavily-extract tools

env.TAVILY_API_KEY: {{apiKey@string::You can get the API key from https://tavily.com}}

description: A Model Context Protocol server providing tools for time queries and timezone conversions for LLMs
args: --local-timezone={{timezone@string::like Asia/Shanghai. You may need install tzdata first}}

description: MCP Server for Timeplus, a SQL database to process millions of rows per second from Kafka, Pulsar, or ClickHouse.
A Model Context Protocol server that provides web content fetching capabilities
A Model Context Protocol server that provides email content fetching and sending capabilities
